intro: Cyanocephalus tagetifolius, commonly known as the bluehead dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flower heads and heart-shaped leaves. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Cyanocephalus tagetifolius is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
